content.question: Which of the following is the correct resolution for the soprano?

choices.label: The figure presents a half note in treble clef. The key signature has two sharps. The pitch of the note is A5.
The figure presents a half note in treble clef. The key signature has two sharps. The pitch of the note is G5.
The figure presents a half note in treble clef. The key signature has two sharps. The pitch of the note is F-sharp 5.
The figure presents a half note in treble clef. The key signature has two sharps. The pitch of the note is D5.

content.answer: The figure presents a half note in treble clef. The key signature has two sharps. The pitch of the note is F-sharp 5.

unit.text: 4: Harmony and Voice Leading I - Chord Function, Cadence, and Phrase

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
